intro: Aucuparia subvestita, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. Native to tropical regions of the Americas, it is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that give way to berries containing numerous seeds. It is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered an invasive species in some areas.
